revised_title: Reinterpreting Coral Growth and Form through Modular Organization
tldr: This paper reinterprets the growth and form of corals in terms of modular construction, exploring the concept of modules and its application to corals. The author suggests that a modular approach can provide a better understanding of coral morphology, colony organization, and growth. By considering coral modules in terms of design and topology, the author aims to advance our knowledge of these organisms and contribute to the broader understanding of metamers, meristems, and modules in biology.
